quizzes.title: History Quiz: Norway and Government
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, mohawk, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What ocean fish migrates from the Pacific Ocean to the Columbia River to spawn at the end of their life cycles?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: More than half of the Yukon River is located within this American state.
What animal is depicted on the Coat of Arms of Norway?
What is the title of the national anthem of Norway?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes, We Love This Country

questions.question: What is the popular Norwegian delicacy called Smalahove made from?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lamb head

questions.question: What type of government does Norway have?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Constitutional monarchy

questions.question: What river in North America provides food for the largest wintering Bald Eagle population in the continental United States?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Skagit River

questions.question: What is Bunad?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A Norwegian costume

questions.question: What is the official language adopted by the government of Norway?
What is the The Rio Grande river called in Mexico?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rio Bravo

questions.question: According to some medieval texts, the name of Norway originated from the name of which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The name of a king

questions.question: What is the predominant form of Christianity in Norway?
What is the meaning of the name of the Mississippi River, which originated from the Ojibwe word misi-ziibi?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Great river

questions.question: What is the name of the capital and largest city of Norway?
What does the Mohawk name of the Saint Lawrence River, Kaniatarowanenneh, mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Big waterway

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Madagascar and Borneo
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, title, kind. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Borneo is the 3rd largest island in the world.
What kind of traditional ritual is the Famadihana, practiced by the Malagasy people in Madagascar?

options.text: Introducing boys into manhood by tattooing and scarring them

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Turning of the dead

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about Madagascar?

options.text: It is slightly smaller than France.
It is the worlds 56th-largest country in terms of area.
It is the fifth largest island in the world.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

questions.question: What are the colors on the national flag of Madagascar, adopted on October 14, 1958?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: White, red and green

questions.question: How many new species of animals and plants were discovered on Borneo between July 2005 and September 2006?
What are the official languages spoken in Madagascar?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Malagasy, French and English

questions.question: What is the largest carnivorous mammal endemic to the island of Madagascar?
Between the 1980s and 2006 Borneo lost approximately 45 % of its rain forests due to logging.
What city is the capital and largest city of Madagascar?
What type of meal is the godro-godro, which is very popular in the Madagascar cuisine?
This tree is a very important part of the Madagascar dry deciduous forests and six species of it are endemic to the island.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Which of the following is present on the national flag of Norway?
What is the name some ecologists use wen referring to Madagascar?

options.text: The island of Adam and Eve

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The eight continent

questions.question: In 1945 Borneo was the site of horrific acts of brutality. The Japanese forced over 6,000 POWs and island civilians to march to a new camp some 160 miles away. This became known as the Sandakan Death March, as only 200 marchers survived to the end of the war.
What is the title of the national anthem of Madagascar, written by Norbert Raharisoa and composed by Rahajason?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Oh, Our Beloved Fatherland

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Island and Greece
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, leader, peak. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the name of the leader of the first squad of Shinsengumi?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Okita Sōji

questions.question: At its peak, how many members did the Shinsengumi group have?
What is the biggest Greek island ?
Which is the largest group of Greek islands?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Cyclades

questions.question: Halkidiki, one of the Greek peninsulas, has a peculiar form which resembles what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A trident

questions.question: Which of the characteristics below is typical for the buildings on the Greek archipelago of Santorini?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The white-and-blue colouring

questions.question: The Shinsengumi group remained loyal to the Tokugawa shogunate until the end of the Bakamatsu.
Which of the following places in Greece is NOT an island?
From the 1600s to the 1800s, the British and Dutch were interested in Borneo because they wanted control of this resource.
Which medieval monument is an essential part of the archaeological sites of the Greek island Rhodes?

options.text: The Palace of the Grand Master

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Palace of the Grand Master

questions.question: According to the Shinsengumi rules, if the leader of a unit is mortally wounded in a fight, what should the rest of the group do?

options.text: Take the body and run away
All members of the unit must fight and die on the spot.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All members of the unit must fight and die on the spot.

questions.question: The Navagio Bay (also known as the Shipwreck) is the most popular beach of which Greek island?
The Corinth Canal separates this Greek peninsula from the mainland of Greece.
The Cave of Melissani is among the most popular geological landmarks of which Greek island?
Which island is NOT a part of Greece?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: River and Shinsengumi
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, sanosuke, jesus. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This European river originates in Germany and empties in the Black Sea via a delta.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Danube

questions.question: What river flows through the central part of the French capital, Paris?
In which city was the Shinsengumi group founded?
What is the name of the longest river in Asia, and the third-longest in the world?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Yangtze

questions.question: This river flows through the southern part of England and passes through the capital of the country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Thames

questions.question: What was the favorite weapon of Harada Sanosuke, the 10th unit captain of the Shinsengumi?
What is the largest river on the planet by volume?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Amazon

questions.question: This river is the longest in the United States, and it gave its name to one of the states.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Missouri River

questions.question: There is a city in Oklahoma called Moon.
What river is considered the longest river on the planet?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Nile

questions.question: Who was Shinsengumi Commander from 1863 to 1868?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kondō Isami

questions.question: What is the name of the holy river of the Hindu people?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Ganges

questions.question: This North American river is also called Kaniatarowanenneh, which means big waterway in Mohawk.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Saint Lawrence River

questions.question: What is the name of the river in which Jesus Christ was baptized by John the Baptist?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Jordan

questions.question: The code of Shinsengumi comprised five rules. What was the punishment for breaking these rules?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Oklahoma and Country
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, lakes, ground. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: There is a town in Oklahoma called IXL.
The national motto of what country is Peace at Home, Peace in the World?
Which of the following is NOT an Oklahoma city?
Carl Albert High School was named after Carl Bert Albert, who was the Speaker of the House of Representatives from 1971 to 1977. What small Oklahoma town did he hail from?
The national motto of what country is A Mari Usque Ad Mare, meaning From Sea to Sea in Latin?
Oklahoma has more man-made lakes than any other state.
A windspeed of 100 feet above the ground was observed in 1999 in what Oklahoma city?
Will Rogers World Airport and the Wiley Post Airport were named after people who died in 1935. How did they meet their demise?

options.text: as a result of a boat accident

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: in a plane crash

questions.question: In what Oklahoma city was the shopping cart invented?
The national motto of the Republic of Botswana is Pula. What does this mean in English?
The national motto of this South American country is Libertad o muerte, Spanish for Liberty or Death.
How many of the astronauts who have flown in space between 1959 and 2009 were from Oklahoma?
Boise City, Oklahoma was the only city within the continental United States to be bombed during World War II.
What does the national motto of India, Satyameva Jayate, mean in Sanskrit?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Truth Alone Triumphs

questions.question: Oklahoma has no cities and communities named after Presidents.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Country and Waterfall
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, niagara, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The national motto of this Arabic country is God is the greatest.
What is the name of the tallest waterfall made by humans, which is located in Umbria, Italy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cascata delle Marmore

questions.question: What is the name of the tallest waterfall in eastern North America?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pissing Mare Falls

questions.question: In what country is the Angel Falls, the highest waterfall on the planet, located?
The slogan Sub Umbra Floreo, or Under the Shade I Flourish is the national motto of what Central American country?
In what European country are the Rhine Falls located?
What is the name of the second-tallest waterfall on the planet?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tugela Falls

questions.question: Jog Falls is the highest plunge waterfall in this Asian country.
What is the meaning of the national motto of the Republic of Indonesia, Bhinneka Tunggal Ika?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Unity in Diversity

questions.question: In what U.S. state is the famous Bridalveil Fall located?
In what country is Jurong Falls, the tallest artificial waterfall in the world, located?
The national motto of the Republic of the Fiji Islands is Rerevaka na Kalou ka Doka na Tui. What does this mean?

options.text: Fear God and honor the Queen
We kneel before you, blessed land

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fear God and honor the Queen

questions.question: Which of these is a section of the famous Niagara Falls?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Horseshoe Falls

questions.question: The national motto of what island country is Ever Conscious of God We Aspire, Build and Advance as One People?
In what U.S. state is the tallest waterfall in the country, Waihilau Falls, located?
